content.user_title: Manage Development Server Ports Across Projects
content.value_statement: Running multiple development projects leads to port conflicts and confusion. Port Allocator assigns unique port ranges to each project automatically.
actual_capabilities: Allocates unique 10-port ranges to projects with package.json
Scans code directories to discover and register new projects
Lists all allocated ports across registered projects
Auto-detects common code directory locations on first run
Configures Claude Code permissions for port management commands
limitations: Only works with projects containing package.json files
Port ranges start at 3000 and increment by 10
Requires manual configuration if code directory is non-standard
Does not monitor or restart services automatically

use_cases.title: Manage Multiple Project Ports
use_cases.description: Run several web applications simultaneously without port conflicts by assigning each project its own dedicated port range.

use_cases.title: Standardize Port Assignments
use_cases.description: Create consistent port allocation across team members so everyone uses the same ports for shared projects.

use_cases.title: Organize Microservices Ports
use_cases.description: Allocate port ranges for services in a microservices architecture with main app, API, and auxiliary service ports.

output_examples.input: What port should I use for my project?

best_practices: Run /port-allocator allow first to configure permissions and avoid confirmation prompts
Use /port-allocator scan after adding new projects to your code directory
Only kill processes within your project port range when restarting services
anti_patterns: Do not use pkill -f node as it will affect other projects
Do not manually assign ports outside your allocated range
Do not overwrite ~/.claude/CLAUDE.md - always append to preserve existing content

faq.question: What port range will my project get?
faq.answer: Each project gets 10 consecutive ports starting from 3000. The first project gets 3000-3009, second gets 3010-3019, and so on.

faq.question: What if my project has no package.json?
faq.answer: The skill only allocates ports to directories containing package.json. Add a package.json or use /port-allocator add to manually register.

faq.question: How do I change my code directory?
faq.answer: Run /port-allocator config ~/your/path to set a custom code directory location.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-Node.js projects?
faq.answer: Yes, but you need a package.json file or use the manual add command to register the project.

faq.question: What happens if I run out of ports?
faq.answer: With 10-port ranges starting at 3000, you can have approximately 700 projects before reaching port 10000.

faq.question: Does this work across multiple Claude Code instances?
faq.answer: Yes, the port registry in ~/.claude/port-registry.json is shared across all Claude Code instances on your machine.
